author: Fran Fuentes
title: Imanol Alguacil, sobre la lesi√≥n de Luka Sucic: "El doctor dice que el cruzado no le salta"
text:
Imanol Alguacil, sobre la lesi√≥n de Luka Sucic: "El doctor dice que el cruzado no le salta"
-
El t√©cnico ha justificado la 'p√°jara' de su equipo en la primera parte
-
"Luka quer√≠a entrar pero yo prefer√≠ no arriesgar", asegura
-
Imanol Alguacil aparca su renovaci√≥n: "Se sabr√° a finales de abril o incluso mayo"
Imanol Alguacil ha comparecido tras el triunfo de la Real Sociedad frente al Midtjylland en la vuelta de play off de la UEFA Europa League. El cuadro txuri urdin ha logrado imponerse por cinco goles a dos, aunque con alg√∫n momento de susto al final de la primera parte y el inicio de la segunda. Sobre esta p√°jara del equipo ha hablado el propio t√©cnico de Orio, justificando en cierto modo lo sucedido. Del mismo modo ha dado alg√∫n detalle sobre la lesi√≥n de Luka Sucic, que se retir√≥ sobre los 48 minutos de partido.
Lo ha hecho en los micr√≥fonos de Movistar Liga de Campeones. En primer lugar ha celebrado el pase de la Real Sociedad, a quien se le resist√≠an las eliminatorias europeas: "Es lo que tocaba. Son ya cinco a√±os consecutivos en Europa y nos estaba costando pasar la eliminatoria. Hoy ya tocaba y la verdad es que contentos".
En este sentido, no cree que esos momentos de zozobra sean algo extra√±o: "M√°s que extra√±o, ten√©is que darle valor a que son 12 partidos en 38 d√≠as. El equipo se ha visto ya con la eliminatoria resuelta con el 2-0 y sin querer han desconectado. Hasta cierto punto es normal porque lo que est√°n pensando es que el domingo tienen un partido important√≠simo. Ya no te cuento nada lo que viene despu√©s. Se han visto con la eliminatoria resuelta, yo creo que han bajado el pist√≥n, hacer lo que no tocaba y se han dado cuenta de que as√≠ es imposible", reconoce.
La justificaci√≥n de Imanol Alguacil: "No somos robots"
Pese a todo, tiene claro que el equipo se ha dejado todo para recuperar el pulso al partido: "Entra dentro de la l√≥gica aunque no queremos que pase, pero no somos robots, somos humanos. El jugador evidentemente nota el cansancio. Al final han intentado tirar de paciencia, parar el partido y menos mal que hemos hecho el 3-2 en el 44 porque seguramente a m√°s de uno le habr√≠a entrado las prisas en el descanso".
Del mismo modo, tiene claro que no ha : "A m√≠ el Legan√©s, el Legan√©s que es el siguiente. Cr3eo que van a ser, despu√©s de haber pasado esta eliminatoria, van a ser 19 seguidos. El que sea".
Por √∫ltimo, valor√≥ la gravedad de la posible lesi√≥n de Luka Sucic, dejando un mensaje de tranquilidad: "Es verdad que ha sido fea. Vamos a esperar a la resonancia de ma√±ana. Evidentemente, √©l quer√≠a entrar. Yo no lo he visto claro. El doctor me ha dicho en un principio que s√≠, pero yo no he querido arriesgar porque son muchos partidos. Necesitamos a todos disponibles y entend√≠ que era un riesgo meterle en el campo. En principio, seg√∫n me ha dicho el doctor, el cruzado no le salta, o sea que esperemos que todo quede en un susto". "Parece que no es mucha cosa".

author: archyde
title: P√©ter N√°das is a cretin who strengthens anti-Semitism in Hungary
text:
In an editorial Zsolt Jeszenszky lectured on the connection between anti-Semitism in Hungary and P√©ter N√°das on the Pesti Sr√°cok. The principle declare of the article is actually that anti-Semitism in our nation is ‚Äúgetting new energy‚Äù due to the orphaning Jews ‚Äì on the similar time, the writer is outwardly being attentive to solely not directly Jewizing when he writes the next:
‚ÄúAnd when the M√°rias, L√°szl√≥s Juszt, and L√°szl√≥ D√©s of V√°s√°rhely, being so indifferent from actuality, not coping with the details, blather not solely in a self-defeating method, however with an infinitely obnoxious, visceral hatred, then anti-Semitism is re-invigorated a bit of.‚Äù
Based on Jeszenszky, there are additionally those that take motion towards anti-Semitism alongside them, corresponding to Imre Kert√©sz and Viktor Orb√°n, ‚Äúwho preserve glorious relations not solely with Israel and its prime minister, but in addition with a big variety of home Jewish organizations and their distinguished representatives.‚Äù
Jeszenszky is cautious, he doesn‚Äôt enterprise into the sphere of aesthetics. He places it like this:
‚ÄúHow good a author is P√©ter N√°das? I do not know. From me, as a author, it‚Äôd even be good. However humanly, he is a cretin.‚Äù
By the way, the editorial is about the truth that N√°das, as a white man, didn‚Äôt obtain a literary award as a result of the jury needed to fulfill the standards of political correctness a lot that in the long run the worth of the works grew to become secondary.
And the way does orphaning and anti-Semitism in Hungary observe from this? No approach. That‚Äôs the reason N√°das recollects Jeszenszky his interview two years in the past by which the author (that‚Äôs, P√©ter N√°das) talked about how the Hungarian navy management in all probability stationed troops on the Ukrainian border the day after the Russian invasion as a result of Orb√°n might get a promise from Putin.
Lastly, the publicist concludes the article:
‚ÄúNicely, with such stinging sentences, such P√©ter N√°das do essentially the most to make sure that Hungarian anti-Semitism, which is disappearing, generally good points new energy.‚Äù
It might solely be good to know whether or not Zsolt Jeszenszky checks the origin of everybody who criticizes the prime minister?

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Chargers News: National Outlets Forecast Chargers Above .500 in Upcoming NFL Season
text:
By Jake Faigus ,
1 hour ago
The Los Angeles Chargers are gearing up for the 2024 NFL season with renewed optimism after a disappointing 2023 campaign.
Following a rough finish last year, the team made significant changes to both their coaching staff and roster, including the high-profile hiring of Jim Harbaugh as head coach.
Harbaugh, fresh off a national championship win with the University of Michigan, returns to the NFL aiming to elevate the Chargers to new heights.
Despite his impressive coaching history, leading the Chargers to success in a competitive division will be a formidable challenge.
The Chargers have undergone a transformation, retaining some key players while integrating new talent. However, questions remain about their ability to compete with the reigning Super Bowl champions, the Kansas City Chiefs.
Noah Camras of Newsweek predicted the Chargers will finish the season with a 9-8 record, placing them second in the AFC West behind the Chiefs, who are expected to go 12-5.
"The Kansas City Chiefs will yet again run away with the AFC West this season. The Los Angeles Chargers will make improvements under new head coach Jim Harbaugh, but it won't be enough to clinch a postseason berth in a loaded AFC," wrote Camras.
The Chargers' offense presents several uncertainties. While quarterback Justin Herbert is a standout player, the supporting cast lacks proven stars.
The running game will feature former Ravens players Gus Edwards and J.K. Dobbins, while the receiving corps includes Quentin Johnston, Ladd McConkey, Joshua Palmer, DJ Chark Jr., Derius Davis, and rookie Brenden Rice.
While none of these receivers are household names, there‚Äôs potential for some to emerge as surprises.
On the defensive side, new coordinator Jesse Minter is tasked with improving a unit that struggled last season. The Chargers boast a strong pass rush with Khalil Mack, Joey Bosa, and Tuli Tuipulotu leading the charge.
With fresh coaching and personnel, the team hopes to turn things around and make a mark in the league.
As the season approaches, the Chargers are looking to prove they can rise above expectations and challenge for a playoff spot in a tough AFC landscape.
